description:
The investment seeks to provide investment results that correspond generally, before fees and expenses, to the performance of the S&P SmallCap 600 Revenue-Weighted Index (the "underlying index").
 The fund will normally invest at least 80% of its net assets, plus any borrowings for investment purposes, in the securities of small capitalization companies included in the underlying index. The underlying index is constructed using a rules-based methodology that re-weights the constituent securities of the S&P SmallCap 600® Index (the "parent index") according to the revenue earned by the companies in the parent index, subject to a maximum 5% per company weighting.
